[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Trait: PersistableConfig] [Type Confusion in Trait] Can type confusion between NodeConfig and SafetyRulesConfig implementations cause validators to load the wrong config type, leading to undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [Repeated Load DoS] Can an attacker trigger repeated config loads by modifying files, causing validators to waste CPU cycles constantly reloading and reparsing configs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [Repeated Save DoS] Can triggering frequent save_config() calls cause I/O starvation, preventing other critical validator operations like block processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: parse_serialized_config()] [Regex DoS in YAML] Does the YAML parser use regular expressions that could be vulnerable to ReDoS attacks when parsing maliciously crafted config strings? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [Serialization Determinism] Is YAML serialization in serde_yaml::to_vec() at line 25 deterministic, or can non-deterministic field ordering cause spurious config updates? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: parse_serialized_config()] [Default Value Injection] Can missing fields in YAML configs cause serde to inject unsafe default values into SafetyRulesConfig, bypassing required security settings? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [BOM Handling] Does the YAML parser correctly handle byte order marks (BOM) in config files, or can BOM-prefixed files cause parsing errors or security bypasses? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [Line Ending Handling] Can differences in line endings (CRLF vs LF) cause config validation failures or enable injection attacks through carefully crafted line breaks? (Low)
